text: Thomas William 'Tom' Chilvers (1919-1990) was an Australian rugby league footballer who played in the 1940s. Like many players of his era, Chilvers' rugby league career was interrupted by his Army service in World War II.WW2 Nominal Roll- Thomas Chilvers http://www.ww2roll.gov.au/Veteran.aspx?ServiceId=A&VeteranId;=313662 In the early 1940s he was playing Reserve Grade with Eastern Suburbs. By 1945, he was stationed in Papua New Guinea with the AIF and survived the conflict. After returning to Sydney in 1946, he joined the St. George Dragons and played two seasons with them, predominantly in Reserve Grade.Alan Whiticker/Glen Hudson: Encyclopedia of Rugby League Players, 1995. Chilvers died on 16 June 1990 in Padstow, New South Wales aged 71.Sydney Morning Herald (Death Notice) 18/6/1990 ==References== Category:Australian military personnel of World War II Category:1919 births Category:1990 deaths Category:Sydney Roosters players Category:St. George Dragons players Category:Rugby league hookers Category:Australian rugby league players Category:Rugby league players from Sydney
